features.feature_reason: The transaction channel affects fraud risk and authentication strength, which are key drivers of interchange fees.
CVV2 result indicates cardholder authenticity and fee risk.
Cross-border transactions involve extra risks and costs, leading to higher interchange fees.
Advanced authentication can lower fraud risk and reduce interchange fees.
ECI code reflects transaction security level, affecting interchange fees.
Merchant category codes group transactions by business type, affecting interchange rates.
How card data was entered affects fraud risk and interchange fee.
Address verification results help assess fraud risk, influencing the interchange fee applied.

transaction_features.feature_reason: E-commerce transaction: higher fraud risk, higher interchange.
CVV2 not provided: issuer loses a key fraud detection tool, increasing expected losses and interchange.
Domestic transaction: lower fraud and operational complexity, lower interchange.
Cross-border transaction: higher fraud risk, higher interchange.
Card-present transaction: lower fraud risk, lower interchange.
CVV2 matched: reduces fraud probability and lowers interchange fee.
